title: Ticket #7100: Per-submitter Flocking
description:
It currently is quite complex for a user to "bring their own resources" to an existing HTCondor setup. It requires careful coordination with the schedd's sysadmin and a very deep level of trust: the sysadmin basically must trust that user with any job (from any user) within the schedd.

We should allow the user to control which collectors they would like their jobs to flock to; in the case where the collector is not on the list of admin-approved flocks, the user should have to maintain their own authentication mechanism (only starting with TOKENS is acceptable).

This way, Anyone With A Credit Card can launch some startds and a collector on Amazon, setup TOKEN auth, and condor_qedit existing jobs to be able to flock to their new condor-in-the-cloud.

See design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/18EA4_KVbVlXHiY5Hi33mYR8pmMTTQfikqtyd8Yh34lw/edit#
